text: Giuliana Chenal-Minuzzo (née Minuzzo, 26 November 1931 – 11 November 2020) was an Italian alpine skier. She was born in Vallonara di Marostica, Italy. ==Olympic career== At the 1952 Olympics in Oslo Minuzzo was the bronze medalist in the women's downhill competition."1952 Winter Olympics – Oslo, Norway – Alpine Skiing" (Retrieved on February 27, 2008) At the 1960 Olympics, she was bronze medalist in the women's giant slalom event."1960 Winter Olympics – Squaw Valley, United States – Alpine Skiing" (Retrieved on February 27, 2008) At the 1956 Winter Olympics in Cortina d'Ampezzo, Minuzzo made history by becoming the first woman to take the Olympic Oath.IOC 1956 Winter Olympics ==Death== On 11 November 2020, Minuzzo died in Aosta, Italy at the age of 88. ==References== ==Other websites== * Giuliana Chenal-Minuzzo at Olympedia Category:1931 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Olympic bronze medalists for Italy Category:Italian skiers Category:Sportspeople from Veneto
title: Giuliana Minuzzo
